KnowledgeBase.Title: bcompareNE
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: bcompare bcompareEQ bcompareGT bcompareGE bcompareLT bcompareLE

Function.Description: The bcompareNE is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Boolean values. It returns true if both objects are not equal and false if otherwise.

Brief.Overview: The bcompareNE is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Boolean values. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false. The operands are not checked and are not coerced.
Brief.Usage: Use the bcompareNE function when you wish to compare two Booleans and determine if {bool1} is not equal to {bool2} and you wish the result to be expressed as a Boolean value (true or false). These functions only operate on Boolean operands. For a more general, but slower, comparison, use the compareEQ, compareNE, compareGT, compareGE, compareLT, and compareLE which performs type checking and type conversions.

Argument.Name: bool1
Argument.Note: The first Boolean to be compared

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the both Booleans are not equal and false is both Booleans are not equal.
